credit_line: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
title: Sampler
provenance: ex. coll. Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, satin and stem stitches on plain weave foundation
description:
Large vase of flowers with verse above and inscription below, surrounded on three sides with a border of roses set in octagonal frames. The verse reads: 

The maid who led by wisdom's guiding hand
Seek's virtue's temple and her law reveres
She She alone in honours dome shall stand
Crownd with Rewards and rais'd above her peers
Re cording annals shall preserve her name
And give her virtues immortal fame

And the inscription: 
Done by Harriet Bradbury August 17 1786
name: Sampler
